==Events==
*[[585 BC]] &ndash; A [[solar eclipse]] occurs, as predicted by the Greek philosopher and scientist [[Thales]], while [[Alyattes of Lydia|Alyattes]] is battling [[Cyaxares]] in the [[Eclipse of Thales|Battle of Halys]], leading to a truce. This is one of the cardinal dates from which other dates can be calculated.
* [[621]] &ndash; [[Battle of Hulao]]: [[Emperor Taizong of Tang|Li Shimin]], the son of the Chinese emperor [[Emperor Gaozu of Tang|Gao Zu]], defeats the numerically superior forces of [[Dou Jiande]] near the [[Hulao Pass]] ([[Henan]]). This victory decides the outcome of the [[Transition from Sui to Tang|civil war]] that followed the [[Sui Dynasty]]'s collapse in favour of the [[Tang Dynasty]].
*[[1503]] &ndash; [[James IV of Scotland]] and [[Margaret Tudor]] are married according to a papal bull by [[Pope Alexander VI]]. A Treaty of Everlasting Peace between [[Scotland]] and [[England]] signed on that occasion results in a peace that lasts ten years.
*[[1533]] &ndash; The [[Archbishop of Canterbury]], [[Thomas Cranmer]], declares the marriage of King [[Henry VIII of England]] to [[Anne Boleyn]] valid.
*[[1588]] &ndash; The [[Spanish Armada]], with 130 ships and 30,000 men, sets sail from [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]], heading for the [[English Channel]]. (It will take until May 30 for all ships to leave port.)
*[[1644]] &ndash; [[Bolton Massacre]] by [[Cavalier|Royalist]] troops under the command of [[James Stanley, 7th Earl of Derby]].
*[[1754]] &ndash; [[French and Indian War]]: in the first engagement of the war, [[Virginia]] [[militia]] under the 22-year-old [[Lieutenant colonel]] [[George Washington]] defeat a [[France|French]] reconnaissance party in the [[Battle of Jumonville Glen]] in what is now [[Fayette County, Pennsylvania|Fayette County]] in southwestern [[Pennsylvania]].
*[[1830]] &ndash; The [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Andrew Jackson]] signs the [[Indian Removal Act]] which relocates [[Native Americans in the United States|Native Americans]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; The [[Paris Commune]] falls. 
*[[1892]] &ndash; In [[San Francisco|San Francisco, California]], [[John Muir]] organizes the [[Sierra Club]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Gare d'Orsay]] railway station is inaugurated in Paris.
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Russo-Japanese War]]: The [[Battle of Tsushima]] ends with the destruction of the [[Russia]]n [[Baltic Fleet]] by [[Admiral]] [[Tōgō Heihachirō]] and the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]].
*[[1907]] &ndash; The first [[Isle of Man TT]] race was held.
*[[1918]] &ndash; The [[Azerbaijan Democratic Republic]] and the [[First Republic of Armenia]] declare their independence.
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[28 May 1926 coup d'état]]: [[Ditadura Nacional]] is established in Portugal to suppress the unrest of the [[History of Portugal#The First Republic|First Republic]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; In the [[Netherlands]], construction of the [[Afsluitdijk]] is completed and the [[Zuiderzee]] bay is [[Zuiderzee Works|converted]] to the freshwater [[IJsselmeer]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; Near [[Callander, Ontario]], [[Canada]], the [[Dionne quintuplets]] are born to Oliva and Elzire Dionne; they will be the first [[Multiple birth|quintuplet]]s to survive [[Infant|infancy]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; [[Alan Turing]] submits ''On Computable Numbers'' for publication.
*  1936   &ndash; [[Klaipėda Radio Station]] begins regular broadcasting.
*[[1937]] &ndash; The [[Golden Gate Bridge]] in San Francisco, California, is officially opened by President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] in [[Washington, D.C.]], who pushes a button signaling the start of vehicle traffic over the span.
*  1937   &ndash; [[Volkswagen]] (VW), the [[Germany|German]] automobile manufacturer was founded.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Belgium]] surrenders to [[Nazi Germany]] to end the [[Battle of Belgium]].
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: [[Norway|Norwegian]], [[France|French]], [[Poland|Polish]] and [[United Kingdom|British]] forces [[Battles of Narvik|recapture]] [[Narvik]] in Norway. This is the first allied infantry victory of the War.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: in retaliation for the [[assassination]] of [[Reinhard Heydrich]], [[Nazism|Nazis]] in [[Czechoslovakia]] kill over 1,800 people.
*[[1951]] &ndash; The British radio comedy program ''[[The Goon Show]]'' was broadcast on the [[BBC]] for the first time.
*[[1952]] &ndash; The women of [[Greece]] are given [[suffrage|the right to vote]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Cuban Revolution]]: [[Fidel Castro]]'s [[26th of July Movement]], heavily reinforced by Frank Pais Militia, overwhelm an army post in El Uvero.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Peter Benenson]]'s article ''The Forgotten Prisoners'' is published in several internationally read [[newspaper]]s. This will later be thought of as the founding of the [[human rights]] organization [[Amnesty International]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[Palestine Liberation Organization]] is formed.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Northern Ireland]]'s power-sharing [[Sunningdale Agreement]] collapses following a [[Ulster Workers' Council strike|general strike]] by [[Ulster loyalism|loyalists]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; Fifteen [[West Africa]]n countries sign the [[Treaty of Lagos]], creating the [[Economic Community of West African States]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; In [[Southgate, Kentucky]], the [[Beverly Hills Supper Club fire|Beverly Hills Supper Club]] is engulfed in fire, killing 165 people inside.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Konstantinos Karamanlis]] signs the full treaty of the accession of [[Greece]] with the [[European Economic Community]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; The 19-year-old [[West Germany|West German]] pilot [[Mathias Rust]] evades [[Soviet Union]] air defenses and lands a private plane in the [[Red Square]] in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]]. He is immediately detained and will not be released until August 3, 1988.
*[[1991]] &ndash; The capital city of [[Addis Ababa]] falls to the [[Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Democratic Front]], ending both the [[Derg]] regime in [[Ethiopia]] and the [[Ethiopian Civil War]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Eritrea]] and [[Monaco]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; The Russian town of [[Neftegorsk, Sakhalin Oblast|Neftegorsk]] is hit by a 7.6 magnitude [[earthquake]] that kills at least 2,000 people, half of the total population.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The U.S. President [[Bill Clinton]]'s former business partners in the [[Whitewater controversy|Whitewater land deal]], [[Jim McDougal]] and [[Susan McDougal]], and the [[List of Governors of Arkansas|Governor]] of [[Arkansas]] [[Jim Guy Tucker]], are convicted of fraud.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Nuclear weapons testing|Nuclear testing]]: [[Pakistan]] responds to a series of nuclear tests by [[India]] with five of its own codenamed '''''[[Chagai-I]]''''', prompting the [[United States]], [[Japan]], and other nations to impose [[economic sanctions]]. Pakistan celebrates [[Youm-e-Takbir]] annually.
*[[1999]] &ndash; In [[Milan]], [[Italy]], after 22 years of restoration work, [[Leonardo da Vinci]]'s masterpiece ''[[The Last Supper (Leonardo da Vinci)|The Last Supper]]'' is put back on display.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[NATO]] declares [[Russia]] a limited partner in the Western alliance.
*  2002   &ndash; The ''[[2001 Mars Odyssey|Mars Odyssey]]'' finds signs of large ice deposits on the planet [[Mars]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Peter Hollingworth]] becomes the first [[Governor-General of Australia]] to resign his office as a result of criticism of his conduct.
*[[2004]] &ndash; The [[Iraqi Governing Council]] chooses [[Ayad Allawi]], a longtime anti-[[Saddam Hussein]] exile, as prime minister of [[Iraq]]'s interim government.
*[[2008]] &ndash; The first meeting of the Constituent Assembly of [[Nepal]] formally declares Nepal a republic, ending the 240-year reign of the [[Shah dynasty]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; In [[West Bengal]], [[India]], a [[Jnaneswari Express train derailment|train derailment]] and subsequent collision kills 141 passengers.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Malta]] [[Maltese divorce referendum, 2011|votes]] on the introduction of [[divorce]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; The discovery of [[Flame (malware)|Flame]], a complex [[malware]] program targeting computers in [[Middle East]]ern countries, is announced.
